name: rectum mucinous adenocarcinoma
definition: A rectal adenocarcinoma that produces mucin. [url:https\://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4110493/]

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a clinical case study, a patient with microsatellite-stable mucinous rectal cancer harboring BRAF V600E and acquired MET amplification responded to the combination treatment of Xalkori (crizotinib) and Zelboraf (vemurafenib), resulting in a rapid clinical and metabolic response (PMID: 27325282).

references.title: MET-Driven Resistance to Dual EGFR and BRAF Blockade May Be Overcome by Switching from EGFR to MET Inhibition in BRAF-Mutated Colorectal Cancer.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a clinical case study, a patient with microsatellite-stable mucinous rectal cancer harboring BRAF V600E eventually developed resistance to Vectibix (panitumumab) and Zelboraf (vemurafenib) combination therapy, potentially due to acquiring amplification of MET (PMID: 27325282).

references.title: MET-Driven Resistance to Dual EGFR and BRAF Blockade May Be Overcome by Switching from EGFR to MET Inhibition in BRAF-Mutated Colorectal Cancer.

clinicalTrials.title: Nivolumab and Ipilimumab in Mucinous Colorectal and Appendiceal Tumors
